intro: Mentha numidica, commonly known as wild mint, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with opposite, ovate leaves that have a serrated margin. Its flowers are small, tubular, and clustered in whorls, producing a strong minty fragrance. Mentha numidica is often used in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb due to its refreshing scent and medicinal properties.
